Content:
### English | [中文](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lookoutldz/easy-requester/main/README-zh.md) # Easy Requester Easy Requester is a lightweight Java/Kotlin HTTP client library built on OkHttp3, providing a simple and easy-to-use API for sending HTTP requests. ---
[![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/io.github.lookoutldz/easy-requester.svg)](https://central.sonatype.com/artifact/io.github.lookoutldz/easy-requester) [![GitHub](https://img.shields.io/github/license/lookoutldz/easy-requester.svg)](https://github.com/lookoutldz/easy-requester/blob/main/LICENSE) [![GitHub stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/lookoutldz/easy-requester.svg?style=social)](https://github.com/lookoutldz/easy-requester)
--- ## Features - Clean API design, easy to use - Support for synchronous HTTP requests - Custom request parameters, headers, and cookies - Automatic serialization and deserialization of JSON data (using Jackson) - Automatic mapping for Kotlin data classes - Custom response and exception handling - Builder pattern with fluent interface - Functional programming style with Kotlin higher-order functions ## Installation ### Maven Add the following dependency to your `pom.xml` file:
Translation:
### English | [中文](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lookoutldz/easy-requester/main/README-zh.md) # Easy Requester Easy Requester는 OkHttp3 기반으로 구축된 가벼운 Java/Kotlin HTTP 클라이언트 라이브러리로, HTTP 요청을 보내기 위한 간단하고 사용하기 쉬운 API를 제공합니다. ---
[![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/io.github.lookoutldz/easy-requester.svg)](https://central.sonatype.com/artifact/io.github.lookoutldz/easy-requester) [![GitHub](https://img.shields.io/github/license/lookoutldz/easy-requester.svg)](https://github.com/lookoutldz/easy-requester/blob/main/LICENSE) [![GitHub stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/lookoutldz/easy-requester.svg?style=social)](https://github.com/lookoutldz/easy-requester)
--- ## 특징 - 깔끔한 API 설계, 사용하기 쉬움 - 동기식 HTTP 요청 지원 - 맞춤형 요청 매개변수, 헤더 및 쿠키 지원 - JSON 데이터 자동 직렬화 및 역직렬화(Jackson 사용) - Kotlin 데이터 클래스 자동 매핑 - 맞춤형 응답 및 예외 처리 - 빌더 패턴과 유창한 인터페이스 - Kotlin 고차 함수와 함께하는 함수형 프로그래밍 스타일 ## 설치 ### Maven `pom.xml` 파일에 다음 의존성을 추가하세요:

RowTranslations.originContent: Easy Requester is a lightweight Java/Kotlin HTTP client library built on OkHttp3, providing a simple and easy-to-use API for sending HTTP requests.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Easy Requester는 OkHttp3 기반으로 구축된 가벼운 Java/Kotlin HTTP 클라이언트 라이브러리로, HTTP 요청을 보내기 위한 간단하고 사용하기 쉬운 API를 제공합니다.

RowTranslations.originContent: - Clean API design, easy to use
- Custom request parameters, headers, and cookies
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - 맞춤형 요청 매개변수, 헤더 및 쿠키 지원

RowTranslations.originContent: - Automatic serialization and deserialization of JSON data (using Jackson)
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - JSON 데이터 자동 직렬화 및 역직렬화(Jackson 사용)

RowTranslations.originContent: - Automatic mapping for Kotlin data classes
- Functional programming style with Kotlin higher-order functions
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - Kotlin 고차 함수와 함께하는 함수형 프로그래밍 스타일

RowTranslations.originContent: Add the following dependency to your `pom.xml` file:

Content:
```xml
<dependency>
    <groupId>io.github.lookoutldz</groupId>
    <artifactId>easy-requester</artifactId>
    <version>2.3.3</version>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle

Add the following dependency to your `build.gradle` file:

RowTranslations.originContent: Add the following dependency to your `build.gradle` file:

Content:
```groovy
implementation 'io.github.lookoutldz:easy-requester:2.3.3'
```
Or add the following dependency to your `build.gradle.kts` file if you are using Kotlin DSL:
Translation: 또는 Kotlin DSL을 사용하는 경우 `build.gradle.kts` 파일에 다음 의존성을 추가하십시오:

RowTranslations.translatedContent: 또는 Kotlin DSL을 사용하는 경우 `build.gradle.kts` 파일에 다음 의존성을 추가하십시오:

RowTranslations.originContent: Or add the following dependency to your `build.gradle.kts` file if you are using Kotlin DSL:

Content:
```kotlin
implementation("io.github.lookoutldz:easy-requester:2.3.3")
```

## Quick Start

### Basic Usage

RowTranslations.originContent: // Using a data class to receive the response
RowTranslations.translatedContent: // Using a data class to receive the response

RowTranslations.originContent: data class User(val id: Int, val name: String)
RowTranslations.translatedContent: data class User(val id: Int, val name: String)

Content: ### Adding Request Parameters
### Adding Headers and Cookies

```kotlin
val headers = mapOf("Authorization" to "Bearer token123")
val cookies = mapOf("sessionId" to "abc123")

EasyHttpGet.doRequest<User>(
    url = "https://api.example.com/users",
    headers = headers,
    cookies = cookies
) { user ->
    println("User info: $user")
}
```
Translation:
```kotlin
val headers = mapOf("Authorization" to "Bearer token123")
val cookies = mapOf("sessionId" to "abc123")

EasyHttpGet.doRequest<User>(
    url = "https://api.example.com/users",
    headers = headers,
    cookies = cookies
) { user ->
    println("User info: $user")
}
```

Content: ### Custom Exception Handling

RowTranslations.originContent: // Handle exceptions here, e.g., retry or log
RowTranslations.translatedContent: // Handle exceptions here, e.g., retry or log

Content: ### Handling Raw Responses

```kotlin
EasyHttpGet.doRequestRaw(url = "https://api.example.com") { response ->
    println("Status code: ${response.code}")
    println("Headers: ${response.headers}")
    println("Body: ${response.body?.string()}")
}
```
Translation:
```kotlin
EasyHttpGet.doRequestRaw(url = "https://api.example.com") { response ->
    println("Status code: ${response.code}")
    println("Headers: ${response.headers}")
    println("Body: ${response.body?.string()}")
}
```

Content: ### Using the Builder Pattern

```kotlin
// Using Class to specify return type
EasyHttpGet
    .Builder(User::class.java)
    .setUrl("https://api.example.com/users/1")
    .setHeaders(mapOf("Authorization" to "Bearer token123"))
    .onSuccess { user ->
        println("Username: ${user?.name}")
    }
    .onException { throwable, request ->
        println("Request failed: ${throwable.message}")
    }
    .build()
    .execute()

// Using TypeReference to handle generic types
EasyHttpGet
    .Builder(object : TypeReference<List<User>>() {})
    .setUrl("https://api.example.com/users")
    .setParams(mapOf("page" to "1"))
    .onSuccess { users ->
        println("User list: $users")
    }
    .build()
    .execute()
```
Translation:
```kotlin
// Using Class to specify return type
EasyHttpGet
    .Builder(User::class.java)
    .setUrl("https://api.example.com/users/1")
    .setHeaders(mapOf("Authorization" to "Bearer token123"))
    .onSuccess { user ->
        println("Username: ${user?.name}")
    }
    .onException { throwable, request ->
        println("Request failed: ${throwable.message}")
    }
    .build()
    .execute()

// Using TypeReference to handle generic types
EasyHttpGet
    .Builder(object : TypeReference<List<User>>() {})
    .setUrl("https://api.example.com/users")
    .setParams(mapOf("page" to "1"))
    .onSuccess { users ->
        println("User list: $users")
    }
    .build()
    .execute()
```

RowTranslations.translatedContent: // Using Class to specify return type

RowTranslations.translatedContent: // Using TypeReference to handle generic types

Content:
## Advanced Usage

### Custom Response Handling

RowTranslations.originContent: // Execute custom logic here, e.g., extract specific headers
RowTranslations.translatedContent: // Execute custom logic here, e.g., extract specific headers

Content: ### Custom OkHttpClient

```kotlin
val okHttpClient = OkHttpClient.Builder()
    .connectTimeout(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
    .readTimeout(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
    .writeTimeout(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
    .build()

EasyHttpGet.doRequest<User>(
    url = "https://api.example.com/users/1",
    okHttpClient = okHttpClient
) { user ->
    println("User info: $user")
}
```
Translation:
```kotlin
val okHttpClient = OkHttpClient.Builder()
    .connectTimeout(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
    .readTimeout(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
    .writeTimeout(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS)
    .build()

EasyHttpGet.doRequest<User>(
    url = "https://api.example.com/users/1",
    okHttpClient = okHttpClient
) { user ->
    println("User info: $user")
}
```

Content:
## Notes

1. When handling Kotlin data classes, ensure you use an ObjectMapper with the Kotlin module:
Translation:
## 참고 사항

1. Kotlin 데이터 클래스를 처리할 때는 Kotlin 모듈이 포함된 ObjectMapper를 사용해야 합니다:

RowTranslations.originContent: 1. When handling Kotlin data classes, ensure you use an ObjectMapper with the Kotlin module:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: 1. Kotlin 데이터 클래스를 처리할 때는 Kotlin 모듈이 포함된 ObjectMapper를 사용해야 합니다:

Content:
```kotlin
   ObjectMapper().registerKotlinModule()
   ```

2. By default, the library automatically detects if the Kotlin module is needed, but in some cases, you may need to specify it manually.

3. All requests are synchronous. If you need asynchronous operations, consider executing them in coroutines or threads.

## License

[MIT License](./LICENSE)

## Contributing

Pull Requests and Issues are welcome!
Translation:
2. 기본적으로 라이브러리는 Kotlin 모듈이 필요한지 자동으로 감지하지만, 경우에 따라 수동으로 지정해야 할 수도 있습니다.

3. 모든 요청은 동기식입니다. 비동기 작업이 필요하면 코루틴이나 스레드에서 실행하는 것을 고려하세요.

## 라이선스

[MIT 라이선스](./LICENSE)

## 기여

풀 리퀘스트와 이슈는 언제나 환영합니다!
